title: Google\Cloud\Spanner\Timestamp
name: Timestamp
description:
Represents a value with a data type of Timestamp.

Nanosecond precision is preserved by passing nanoseconds as a separate argument to the constructor. If nanoseconds are given, any subsecond precision in the timestamp will be overridden when encoding the timestamp as a string.

Extends Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp

params.name: value
params.description: The timestamp value. Use of DateTimeImmutable is highly recommended over DateTime in order to avoid side effects.

params.name: nanoSeconds
params.description: The number of nanoseconds in the timestamp. If omitted, subsecond precision will be obtained from the instance of \DateTimeInterface provided in the first argument. If provided, any precision in $value below seconds will be disregarded.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get the underlying \DateTimeInterface implementation.

Please note that if you provided nanoseconds when creating the timestamp, they will not be included in this value.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp

methods.name: nanoSeconds
methods.description:
Return the number of nanoseconds.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp

methods.name: formatAsString
methods.description:
Format the value as a string.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp

methods.name: formatForApi
methods.description:
Format a timestamp for the API with nanosecond precision.

Implemented in Google\Cloud\Core\Timestamp
